Psilotum nudum (L.) Beauv. 科名：PSILOTACEAE
漢名：松葉蕨
Synonyms
Description
Aerial stems green, erect or pendent, 10-50 cm long, angular; leaves awl-shaped, 1-2 mm long. Widely distributed in tropics and subtropics. Terrestrial or more often epiphytic; small plants usuall erect; large plants pendent.
Specimen collections
TAIPEI: Tatungshan, Kuo 2334*. IISINCHU: Manabashan, Do 725. NANTOU: Chingshuikou, Huang 1940. PINGTUNG: Nanjenshan, Kao 73440. TAITUNG: Tawu, Chuang 3461; Is. Lanyu, Huang & Kao 5458. HUALIEN: Chingshuishan, Nakamura 3578.

Lycopodium annotinum L. 科名：LYCOPODIACEAE
漢名：杉葉蔓石松
Synonyms
Description
Terrestrial plants; main stems trailing on ground, leafy branches numerous, erect, simple or once forked, usually terminated by a single sessile strobilus. Sterile leaves elliptical, the margins slightly serrulate, 4-6 mm long, rigid and spirally arranged, spreading horizontally or somewhat reflexed with up-curved apices. Strobili 14-20 cm long; sporophylls ovoid, cuspidate, the margins erose. Distributed in the cooler regions of the northern hemisphere. Seldom in mountain forests.
Specimen collections
nodata

Lycopodium carinatum Desv. 科名：LYCOPODIACEAE
漢名：覆葉石松
Synonyms
Description
Epiphytes, pendent; stems 65-80 cm long, 3-5 mm in diameter, forking. Leaves lanceolate, 7-10 mm long, pointing towards apex, appressed decreasing in size towards apex and merging intosporophylls. Fertile spikes 2, terminal, 10-15 cm long, 3 mm thick. Distributed in tropical Asia, Hainan, the Ryukyus, Taiwan and Polynesia. Epiphytic in mountain forests.
Specimen collections
nodata

Engelhardia roxburghiana Wall. 科名：JUGLANDACEAE
漢名：黃杞
Synonyms
Description
Deciduous trees to 10 m tall. Leaves even pinnate, 7-40 cm long; petioles 1.8-4 cm long; leaflets 2-5 pairs, lanceolate-elliptic to long-elliptic, 5-22 cm long, 2-5.2 cm wide, entire, coriaceous, acute or acuminate at apex, oblique at base, lateral veins 7-15 pairs; petiolules 0.5-1 cm long. Staminate inflorescence, several arranged in a panicle; staminate flowers sessile or subsessile; perianth 4-parted; stamens 10-12, anthers nearly sessile. Pistillate inflorescence, terminal, solitary or each combined with several staminate inflorescences in an androgynous panicle; pistillate flowers pedicelled; bracts 3-lobed; perianth 4-parted; ovary globose; stigma 2-parted; pedices ca. 1 mm long. Nutlets globose, ca. 3 mm across; bracts 3-lobed, median lobe 1.5-2.5 cm long, lateral lobes 1-1.5 cm long.
Specimen collections
TAIPEI: Pinglin, Yang 1524. ILAN: Doba, Suzuki 6315. TAICHUNG: Chia-pao-tai, Liu et al. s. n. 1956. NANTOU: Hsitou, Liu & Kuo s. n. 1958; Sun-Moon-Lake, Hsieh 1366; Meiyuan, Saito s. n. 1924. KAOHSIUNG: Tengchih, Huang & Huang 13853. PINGTUNG: Ching-sui-ying, Sasaki s. n.; Nanjenshan, Hu 808. TAITUNG: Souka, Keng s. n. 1955; Tawu, Keng s. n. 1955.

Juglans cathayensis Dode 科名：JUGLANDACEAE
漢名：野核桃 台灣胡桃
Synonyms
Description
Deciduous trees, 12-25 m high; bud scales with dense brown hairs. Leaves 40-50 cm long, brown pubescent on rachis; petioles 15-23 cm long, brown pubescent; leaflets 9-17, sessile or subsessile, chartaceous, ovate-elliptic or long-ovate, 8-15 cm long, 3-7.5 cm wide, acute or acuminate at apex, obliquely rounded or cordate at base, margins serrate, somewhat pubescent on veins of upper surface, densely pubescent on lower surface, lateral veins 11-17 pairs. Staminate inflorescence 18-25 cm long, sparsely pubescent on rachis; staminate flowers glandular; stamens ca. 13, anthers ca. 1 mm long, pubescent. Pistillate inflorescence 8-15 cm long, brown pubescent; pistillate flowers with dense brown glands; ovary ovoid. Fruit ovoid or ovate-globose, 3-5 cm long; pericarp brown glandular; nut 6-8-ridged.
Mainland China and Taiwan. Taiwan, in forests from 1,200 to 2,000 m throughout of the island.
Specimen collections
TAOYUAN: Litungshan, Kawakami 1913. HSINCHU: Sintikusyu, Suzuki 20681. NANTOU: Suili, Liao et al. 12731; Alishan to Hoshe, Tamura et al. 22272. TAICHUNG: Techi, Kao 10674; Wu-ling Farm, Wang 4322. TAITUNG: Peinan, Kawakami & Mori 1830.

Platycarya strobilacea Sieb. & Zucc. 科名：JUGLANDACEAE
漢名：化香樹
Synonyms
Description
Deciduous trees; buds ovoid, scales mucronate at apex, margins short ciliate, slightly pubescent outside; young branches brown pubescent, soon glabrous. Leaves 15-30 cm long, rachis sparsely brown pubescent, later nearly glabrous then; petioles 3-4 cm long, sparsely brown pubescent, nearly glabrous; leaflets 9-19, chartaceous, slightly pubescent on midvein of upper surface, pubescent in axil of lateral veins of lower surface, lateral leaflets sessile, lanceolate-ovate or oblong-lanceolate, 4-11 cm long, 1.5-3.5 cm wide, attenuate to apex, obliquely obtuse or rounded at base, margins serrate, terminal leaflet with petiolule 0.5-2 cm long, attenuate to apex, rounded or cuneate at base. Staminate inflorescence 4-10 cm long; staminate flowers with broadly ovate bracts; bracts 2-3 mm long; stamens 6-8. Pistillate inflorescence 1-3 cm long; pistillate flowers with lanceolate-ovate bracts; bracts stiff, attenuate to apex, 2.5-3 mm long; perianth 2-parted, fused to ovary. Frutescence ovate-ellipsoid or ellipsoid, 2.5-4 cm long, 2-2.5 cm across; persistent bracts woody, deltoid-ovate, 7-10 mm long, acute to acuminate; fruit a nutlet, flattened, narrowly winged, 4-6 mm long, 3-5 mm wide. Seeds ovoid.
Japan, Korea, mainland China and Taiwan. Taiwan, in the forests of the northern and central parts of this island.
Specimen collections
HSINCHU: Kuan-wu, Huang 4122. TAICHUNG: Sung-mao, Hsu 8791; Lishan, Kuo 7651. NANTOU: Tungpu to Patungkuan, Tamura et al. 21920. HUALIEN: Tienhsiang, Yang 0515.
Fruits

Deciduous, monoecious trees (in Taiwan). Leaves alternate, pinnate, estipulate. Staminate inflore-scences solitary catkins or clusters of 3 or more catkins; staminate flowers in axil of a bract, with or without 2 bracteoles; perianth 0 or of 3-6 scales on the margins of bracts, epigynous; stamens 3-40, on bracts, filaments short, anthers basifixed, 2-locular, dehiscing longitudinally. Pistillate inflorescences many-flowered catkins or 2- several-flowered spikes; pistillate flowers bracteate; perianth 4-parted or none, fused with ovary; ovary bicarpellate, rarely of 3 or 4 carpels, inferior, 1-locular, style 2-bifid, stigmatic branches 2-4; ovule 1, erect, orthotropous. Fruit a nut or a drupe or a 2-, 3- or circular-winged samara; seed basifixed, solitary, without endosperm, cotyledons 4-lobed, often fleshy.
Genera eight, species about 60, primarily north temperate; three genera in Taiwan.

1. Leaves even pinnate, with 2-5 pairs of leaflets; leaflets entire, petiolulate ........................ 1. Engelhardia
1. Leaves odd pinnate, with 7-15 pairs of leaflets; leaflets serrulate or serrate, sessile or nearly so.
2. Leaflets oblong or oblong-ovate or elliptic; fruit a drupe, without wings, more than 2 cm long, densely hairy . ........................................................................................................ 2. Juglans
2. Leaflets ovate- or oblong-lanceolate; fruit a nutlet, with 2 narrow wings, less than 5 mm long, glabrous ....... .................................................................................................... 3. Platycarya

Deciduous trees; buds naked. Leaves alternate, even pinnate; leaflets 4-10, entire or serrate. Staminate inflorescence in clusters of 3-6, or several combined in a panicle or an androgynous panicle; staminate flowers with 3-lobed bract; perianth 4-parted or reduced; stamens 3-15. Pistillate inflore-scence a long catkin; pistillate flowers with 3-lobed bract adnate to lower half of ovary; perianth 4-parted; ovary inferior, 2-carpellate, incompletely 2- or 4-celled; stigma 2- or 4-parted. Fruit a small nutlet; wings 3-lobed, fused to lower part of fruit.
Five species, northern India to eastern China, Indochina, East Indies and the Philippines. One species in Taiwan.
Engelhardia roxburghiana 黃杞
Pseudelephantopus spicatus 假地膽草

Deciduous trees; pith solid; buds with scales. Leaves alternate, odd pinnate, serrate. Inflorescences catkins, erect, terminal on main branch or upper short lateral branches, or combined in androgynous corymbs. Staminate flowers with an unlobed bract, without bracteoles and perianth; stamens 4 or 5 on the bract and 3 or 4 on rachis of inflorescence. Pistillate flowers with a stiff unlobed bract and 2 bracteoles fused with 2 lateral perianth; ovary 1-celled; stigmas 2, carinate. Frutescence cone-like, erect, with persistent bracts; fruit a small flattened nutlet, with 2 small wings.
Two species, Japan, Korea, mainland China and Vietnam. One species in Taiwan.

Deciduous trees; pith chambered; buds several-scaled. Leaves alternate, odd-pinnate; leaflets serrate or entire. Pistillate inflorescence terminal on branches of the present year, many-flowered; pistillate flowers with 1 bract and 2 bracteoles fused to ovary; perianth 4-parted, fused to ovary at lower part; ovary inferior, 2-carpellate; stigmas 2, carinate. Fruit drupe-like, husk usually indehiscent.
Around 20 species, temperate and tropical regions. One species in Taiwan.

d:entry.d:title: Front/Back Matter
d:entry.div: This is Flora of Taiwan 2 dictionary.

To see this page,
Open "Go" menu.
Choose "Front/Back Matter" menu item. If it has sub-menu items, choose one of them.

To prepare the menu item, do the followings.
Prepare this page source as an entry.
Add "DCSDictionaryFrontMatterReferenceID" key and its value to the plist of the dictionary. The value should be the string of this page entry id.
